title: The Comfort of Saturdays
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Isabel, looking away from Stella, gazed out of the window. A man was walking up Dundas Street; a man wearing a chocolate-brown corduroy jacket of the fusty, vaguely raffish sort once worn by art teachers. He stopped and patted the pockets of his jacket, as if feeling for something that he hoped he had brought with him, before glancing in through  the café window.

title: The Comfort of Saturdays
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She was so engrossed in her work that she did not notice that midday had crept up on her, and when the grandfather clock in the hall struck it brought her back from the world of traditional recipes and exploitation, of out-of-control trolley cars and moral dilemmas, and back into the present world of lunch appointments. She had arranged to meet Stella Moncrieff in Glass and Thompson, the café at the top of Dundas Street that she liked to frequent. It was on the other side of town  for both her and Stella – Princes Street being the divider, every bit as effective  as a swift-flowing river, that split the city in two – but she liked that part of town with its galleries and views of the Fife hills.

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 1
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: That and nought else. And now, you dear old pious ingrate, on this Christmas morning, think what your mercies have been; and do not walk too far before your breakfast - as far as to the top of India Street, then to the top of Dundas Street, and then to your ain stair heid; and do not forget that even as LABORARE, so JOCULARI, EST ORARE; and to be happy the first step to being pious.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: '883 now, you dear old pious ingrate, on this Christmas IET ' ** morning, think what your mercies have been ; and do not walk too far before your breakfast as far as to the top of India Street, then to the top of Dundas Street, and then to your ain stair heid ; and do not forget that even as labor are, so joculari, est or are ; and to be happy the first step to being pious.

title: The Comfort of Saturdays
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: It was only a short distance down Dundas Street to the Scottish Gallery, and Isabel sauntered in that direction, glancing on the way into the windows of the neighbouring galleries. One  of them, which specialised in sporting scenes and landscapes, displayed a large china hare, caught in mid-leap, astonishingly realistic.

title: The Uncommon Appeal of Clouds
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Peploe who ran the Scottish Gallery in Dundas Street.
